title: How do I know if a woman is just trying to get free stuff?
self_text: I am getting tired of being asked for money and gifts, so I'm going to stop giving it out unless it's an emergency or something that can be returned with receipts. So how do I tell if she's doing this as a means to get some free stuff from me?

title: How does the USA’s tax system work?
self_text: The US tax system is pretty confusing, so I'm trying to understand how it works.  I know that you pay income tax based on your income and there are deductions and credits that can reduce your tax burden, but what exactly happens after you pay your taxes? What do the IRS use the money for?   Also, why do they call it "income" when it is actually a payment made by an employer/company?

title: Why do people have a very distinct look and smell when they are drunk?
self_text: I've noticed that certain groups of people, like college students or barflies, seem to develop a very specific and noticeable look and smell when they are drunk. It isn't just the slurred speech, it is also a distinctive smell and physical appearance.  I’m not sure how much this is due to genetics but if you were to combine all the people who drink regularly, would you be able to identify them in a crowd?  Is there something about alcohol that causes these changes?

title: Is it possible to live without any form of social media?
self_text: I’m starting to get an existential crisis, and after thinking about it for a while, I think that social media is the root cause of all my problems. I just want to be done with it once and for all.

title: Why is the sky blue?

self_text: I am currently dating a girl that is super sweet and amazing, but she doesn't respond to me as much as I like her to. Now I have been thinking about an AI Chatbot that will always be there for me no matter what. Like how my phone has Siri or Google Assistant and I can ask them anything. Is it weird to want a relationship with an AI chatbot? Also do you think that AIs would eventually become capable of having relationships with humans in the future?

title: How does the word "cool" come to be?
self_text: I'm not sure, but it sounds like something that would have been around in old time. Like, a cool thing is cold, so what's the story behind the word?

title: How does the world's economy function?

title: How do you say “I’m in trouble” in different languages?

title: What is the biggest difference between a white person and a black person?
self_text: I’m not asking about race or identity, I'm just curious as to what they physically look like.

title: Can I use a phone to play and record music, or do you need to buy an external drive?

title: What is the best way to keep a pet snake?
self_text: I recently got a baby corn snake and have no idea how to take care of it. I've looked around online, but there are many different ideas. I need someone who has experience with keeping snakes to give me some advice.

title: Why do people keep saying "I'm not sure" when they know the answer?
self_text: If you have no idea what is going on and it can be answered with a simple yes or no question, why are you not just giving an honest answer? It seems like you're trying to trick me into thinking you know the answer when you don't.  If you don't want to say "yes", then at least say "no".  If you don't want to say "no", then give me your best guess.  It seems like you're trying to get out of answering the question in a weird way. I feel like if someone doesn't know something, they should just admit it.  People are afraid to admit that they don't know things, and it makes them look dumb.  I think people need to start being more honest about their lack of knowledge.  This will make life easier for everyone involved.  I'm not sure how much more of this I can take.  You can help by providing information and/or making suggestions.  What do you think?

title: Why do people always use the word "like" as a filler word?
self_text: I hate hearing people say things like “I was, like, going to” or “It’s, like, really hot.”  What is it about that word? Is it because they are shy or just bad at speaking in public?

title: Why are there so many people with the same name?
self_text: I just saw a friend named Michael and another person named Michael at a restaurant and it made me wonder why so many people have the same name?

title: Why is the US so bad at baseball?
self_text: I'm not saying they can't play, but compared to other countries like Japan or Dominican Republic, American baseball players are terrible. What is going on?

title: How do you know if you're actually a robot?
self_text: I was just thinking about this and thought I could ask here to see what the consensus is.  If you were made of metal, silicon, plastic, etc., how would you know it wasn't a simulation or some other trick? If you are truly a robot, what would be the difference between you and me? What makes you different?  I feel like the question is pointless because I don't even know if I am a robot.

title: What is the reason people call the US "America"?
self_text: I know that America is the name of a country, but why do they call it America?

title: How do I avoid getting stuck in a loop of thinking about something?
self_text: I keep thinking and thinking and thinking about it, which is bad for my mental health. How do I avoid this?

title: Why is it considered rude to make eye contact for a long time?
self_text: I have never heard about it, but sometimes people would avoid looking directly at me and if I do look back they would turn their head away. So why is it rude to maintain eye contact with someone for too long? Is it because it's aggressive or because of something else?

title: What is the best way to cut a pizza?
self_text: I’m a beginner and have no idea how to do it properly, any advice?

title: Why are there so many of the same thing?

title: How do I make a perfect pancake?
self_text: It's so simple, yet so difficult! Can anyone help me out?

title: Why do people always talk about the time it took to get a COVID vaccine?
self_text: Like I'm not saying they shouldn't, but why is everyone so fixated on the amount of time it takes to get the vaccine and when people have had them?  I mean, it's not like we can just go get one today. It's been over 2 years since the pandemic started and still people are talking about how long it took for each person to get vaccinated or boosted.  It's starting to become annoying because there's no point in worrying about it anymore as the vaccines are available to almost everyone now.

title: Can you still get a job as an IT technician if you're not certified?
self_text: I've been working in IT for the past 7 years and it's mostly troubleshooting, which is something I enjoy but doesn't require me to be a certified expert. As I look at more career opportunities, I see many positions that require certifications, such as CompTIA A+, Network+, etc. I know it would be nice to have these certificates to show my knowledge, but it will take time and money. Would it be wise to just keep doing what I'm doing, or should I go ahead and start getting some certifications?

title: Is it okay to buy a used car that has been totaled?
self_text: I'm looking for an affordable car and saw a car that was totaled, but it was repaired by the insurance company and sold again. It's pretty cheap and I can afford it, but is there any risk associated with buying a car like that?

title: Why can't I get a job in the USA?

I have a US passport and am willing to work anywhere in the country. I'm not even looking for high-paying jobs, just something that pays enough to live on and has decent benefits. What's wrong with my application?

title: Why are people so rude to people with mental health conditions?

title: If I am not in a country that uses the metric system, can I still use it?

title: Why do people eat fish in the US?
self_text: I'm from England and most people don't eat fish very often, usually only for a special occasion. It’s so expensive here! What is it about American culture that makes people want to eat fish more often than others? Is there something specific they like to cook with fish?

title: Why are some people so weird about wearing socks with sandals?
self_text: I feel like there's a reason why it is frowned upon and if you wear them, they look really bad. Is there any history to that?  I just don't get it.

title: Why does the US have a black and white flag when they send aid to other countries?
self_text: I saw it on a news story and it really made me question why they would use that, as it seems like it is not representative of their country.

title: Why is it a crime to make your own weapon?

title: What is the purpose of a "coke" or “fizz” in a soda?

title: Is it weird to be really good at something you don't enjoy?

title: Is it normal to go to the bathroom when you're happy?
self_text: I've been having more bowel movements than usual lately and thought it was because of the change in diet, but now that my diet has stabilized, I still have a lot of bowel movements. When I get really excited about something, or just feel good about myself, I want to go to the bathroom. It seems weird to me, as it is so often associated with sadness and depression.

title: How many times can you be a millionaire?

title: Why is it that when you use a calculator to solve the equation, the answer always has the same number of decimal points as if you solved it by hand? I've tried several different calculators and they all have the same pattern. Is there some mathematical reason why this happens?

title: What's the difference between a 'new' and 'used' car?

title: Why is the weather so hot right now?
self_text: It's like 85°F (29°C) and humid. I have been sweating a lot and it feels awful.

title: Why do people take pictures of food?
self_text: I've seen a lot of people taking pictures of their food on Instagram and other social media platforms, but why? It seems like it would be easier to just eat the food. Is there something that I am missing here?

title: What's the deal with all of those "What If" questions?
self_text: I've been seeing a lot of these, and they always have a certain tone about them that makes me think people are trying to make a point.  I get it. They can be fun for thought experiments, but why do so many of them come off as just sad or angry?  Why do we want to know if X would happen, when it will likely never happen?   Is there something about us humans that makes us obsessed with hypotheticals?

title: What are the weirdest things you've ever seen?
self_text: I want to hear all of your weird stories about what you've witnessed, and I will try my best to keep it as unbiased as possible.

title: Why do we have to pay for the internet?
self_text: The government should be paying for it and giving it out free to everyone. If I don't use the internet, why should I pay for it?

title: Can a black hole cause a global climate change?
self_text: I was reading about the effects of dark matter and dark energy, which is fascinating but also confusing. Also, how can we tell if our Sun will eventually die? Is it just a natural part of the life cycle of stars?  I'm not asking for an expert answer, I just want to understand what’s going on here. I know that stars do not live forever, but it doesn't really make sense to me why the universe has been around so long and we haven't reached some sort of end yet. So many theories and no solid answers. The question is, if a black hole were to suck in Earth, would the planet be destroyed completely or would there be a shift in the weather patterns globally? Would it even have any effect at all?

title: Why are people so weird when it comes to the way they eat?
self_text: I've noticed that some people have specific ways of eating, like not cutting up their food, or only eating certain parts of a meal. It seems very strange and doesn't make any sense to me why they would do that. Is there any reason why?

title: What is the point of having a phone when you can't use it?

title: Why do some people use the word "gay" to mean something else?

title: Why do people in the US use so much cheese on their pizzas?
self_text: I've been to a few pizza places in the US, and I'm always surprised by how much cheese is put on them. It's usually enough to cover the whole surface of the pizza. Is it because Americans really love cheese? Or is there some other reason?

title: Does it have to be all of the same color?

title: What is the best way to use a 1998 205mm lens on a digital camera?

title: Why does it take so long to find a good job?
self_text: I'm 21, have a degree in computer science, and I haven't been able to find a job yet.  I've applied to dozens of jobs (50+), and the amount of rejection emails is insane. It feels like there are so many other people applying for the same jobs as me.  It makes me feel really hopeless about my future.  I know it takes time to find a job, but it seems like I'm just spinning my wheels here.  Does anyone else feel this way? What can I do to improve my chances?  Is it because I don't have experience or skills that employers want? Are there any specific things I should be doing differently?

I have a black cat and my room mates are really messy so they don't do their part in keeping the place clean. What am I doing wrong?  Do I need to buy an air purifier or something?

title: Why does the world seem to be moving faster these days?

title: What's the best way to make a really good cup of coffee?

I know those are bad habits, and that i should try to fix them, but honestly I don’t know how. What do you guys think?

title: How many of the world's people are not from the USA?

Like, how much do most countries have to lose if America were to suddenly go away?   I know this is probably an odd question, but I'm trying to get a better understanding of the world.

title: How do you make an omelet in a pan?

title: Why do people get so worked up about the idea of a “dark web” when it’s basically just the regular internet, but with less censorship?
self_text: It's like we’re all paranoid that the FBI is watching us, and they are! It doesn't make them more powerful or dangerous, right?  I'm not saying there aren't bad things on the dark web, I am just saying that it's not some evil underground network that wants to destroy your life.

title: Why is it a big deal to be fat?
self_text: I don't understand the obsession with being thin and how much people shame those who aren't. It just seems like a waste of energy and money.  I’m not saying I want to be overweight, but why do people always make comments about my weight or judge me for it? I've been told I have a 'soft' body, which is an insult. I’m just asking why they are so obsessed with being skinny?

title: Why is it so hard to find a good job?
self_text: I've been searching for jobs for over 10 years and still have not found a stable job.  I'm tired of being unemployed, I want to make a livable wage.

title: Why do people only talk about the 90's?

title: Is it okay to use a calculator during the ACT?

title: Why are some people like the smell of dirty socks?
self_text: I don’t know why but I can’t stand it, and I have friends who really enjoy the smell of dirty socks! Is there anything that explains why some people like it more than others?

title: Why do people say “I’m fine” when they’re clearly not?
self_text: Like, why don’t people just be honest about how they feel?  It’s weird. I mean it’s a little bit odd and annoying. It's like the default response for most of the time. What is wrong with people?

title: Why does everyone have a different opinion about how to fold a fitted sheet?
self_text: I've been folding fitted sheets for over 20 years and the method that I do has never failed me, but people keep telling me I am doing it wrong.  I always fold them in half and then turn them right side out so they can be neatly stacked on top of each other.  People say that is the worst way to fold a fitted sheet.  I'm not sure why it's so bad because it works for me.   The only time my folded sheets look messy is when I don't fold them.  Is there any specific reason why people do it differently?

title: Is it bad to be a weirdo?
self_text: I'm just asking because I don't want to get beat up for being myself, but if people are going to look at me like that then I will stop.

title: What do people think about a man who doesn't have kids?
self_text: As a man in my late 30s, I don't plan on having children but some of my friends are wondering why I don't want them and if it is something that can be changed. I've been told by various people (parents, relatives) that "everyone has kids" or "it's your responsibility to continue the human race."  I don't understand how they came to this conclusion. I like my life as it is. I'm happy with what I do, and it would not make me happier to have a kid. Are there specific reasons why it might be considered weird for a man not to have kids? Do you feel like a man who does not want kids is inherently selfish?

title: Why does my cat look like a weird little alien?
self_text: My cat is long and skinny, with a weird face that looks like it's perpetually frowning. It's not even an old cat! What am I doing wrong?

title: Why do some people say "you're welcome"?
self_text: I think it's so weird and unnatural that someone says that to me when I say thank you. It sounds like they are saying, "I don't know what to say" or something.  What is the purpose of saying "you're welcome"?  It seems unnecessary.
